definition: jurist/member of the pre-Han legalist school
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: We caught up with a variety of lawyers and legal academics on the deal.
sentences.chinese: 我们就此协议联系了许多律师和法学家。

sentences.english: Whoever wishes to be a jurisconsult, let him continually study, and desire to be taught by every one.
sentences.chinese: 欲成为法学家者，应不断追求学问，并向一切人学习。

sentences.english: He was a very competent lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位很有才干的法学家。

sentences.english: The resourceful jurist formed a plan to recover his own laurels .
sentences.chinese: 足智多谋的法学家已经想出了一个恢复名誉的计策。

sentences.english: Law Master basically fosters " jurisconsult " , it is academic research talent.
sentences.chinese: 法学硕士主要培养“法学家”，是学术研究型人才。

sentences.english: U. S. (Austrian-born) jurist and public official.
The Danish grammarian Jespersen first proposed the idea in 1886.
sentences.chinese: 最先由丹麦语法学家叶斯伯森于1886年提出。

definition: grand justice/high court justice/supreme court justice

pinyin: gong1 gong4 zhi1 shi5 fen4 zi3
